original: Alvin, Ragnar Oscar Reinhold, lektor, Linköping, f. 1/5/83 i Linköp. av kontr iprosten Anders A. o. Rosa Santesson. G. 13 m. Isabella Hoff. — Mog:ex. i Linköp. 01, fil. kand. i Lund 06, fil. lic. 12, fil. dr 15, provår i Lund 10. Res. t. Köpenh. o. Berlin 06, Tyskl. o. Österr. 22 o. 23, Tjeckoslov. 24, Tyskl., Tjeckoslov., Österr. o. Ital. 26. E. o. aman. v. Vadstena landsarkiv 03-04, vik. andre lär. v. Svalövs folkhögsk. 06-07, vik. adj. i Växjö 09, e. o. lektor i Sundsvall s. å., vik. adj. v. Linköp. folksk:sem. 11. o. 13, adj. v. Karol. lärov. i Örebro 13, lär. v. Örebro handigymn. 14-16, lektor i Falun 17, vik. lektor v. Linköp. h. a. 1. 13-14, lektor i modersm. o. fil. propedevtik där sed. 21, lär. v. Linköp. flickgymn. 22-31. Led. av domkap. o. domkyrkostyr. i Lin.köp. 21-36, av exrndn f. priv. i Sth.lm 25-28, i Norrköp. 29. Skr.: Abraham Sahlstedt (grad:avh. 14), kultur- o. perisonhist. ar b. samt bidr. av likn. inneh. li skilda publ. m. m. RNO.
translated: Alvin, Ragnar Oscar Reinhold, a lecturer living in Linköping, was born on May 1st, 1883 in Linköping to the contract inspector Anders A. and Rosa Santesson. He married Isabella Hoff and they were together for 13 years. Alvin completed his degree in Philosophy in Lund in 1906, a licentiate in Philosophy in 1912, and received a doctorate in Philosophy in 1915. He served as a resident in Copenhagen and Berlin in 1906, in Germany and Austria in 1922 and 1923, in Czechoslovakia in 1924, and in Germany, Czechoslovakia, Austria, and Italy in 1926. He was an assistant and a deputy archivist at the Vadstena National Archives from 1903-1904, as well as a deputy teacher at Svalöv People’s College in 1906-1907. He was a deputy adjutant in Växjö in 1909, teaching at the Örebro Handicrafts School from 1914-1916, and a lecturer in Falun in 1917. He was a deputy lecturer in Linköping in 1913-1914 and then rose to become a lecturer of mother tongue and philosophy pedagogy in 1921. He taught at the Linköping Girls' Gymnasium from 1922-1931. He was a member of the Cathedral Chapter and the Cathedral Board in Linköping from 1921-1936, an external member of the Royal Academy of Science in Stockholm from 1925-1928, and a member in Norrköping in 1929. He wrote a doctoral thesis on Abraham Sahlstedt (graduate work in 1914) and several other cultural and historical publications. He was awarded the Royal Order of the North Star.

structured.name: Ragnar Oscar Reinhold Alvin

hasOccupation.name: Lecturer of Mother Tongue and Philosophy Pedagogy, Linköping

award.name: Royal Order of the North Star

structured.description: Ragnar Oscar Reinhold Alvin (1883-05-01 - unknown) was a Swedish lecturer and author.
